TopicTitle: Proof squad was trying something BIG?

Articles.Content:
Found this in an old .21 game file in the resources generic file

What on the face of the planet has a density of 0.3???! Most everything else is .005

RESOURCE_DEFINITION
{
  name = Testium
  density = 0.3
  flowMode = ALL_VESSEL
  transfer = PUMP
  color = 0.4 0.2 0.8
}

The only mod I had that added resources was kethane (others installed where, engineer redux, KAS, Quantum struts, and sub-assembly manager,) but its in the stock genericÃ¢â‚¬Â¦Ã¢â‚¬Â¦..

WHAT ARE YOU TestiumÃ¢â‚¬Â¦. I demand to know!

If anyone else still has a copy of .21.1 look this up.

RESOURCE_DEFINITION
{
  name = Testium
  density = 0.3
  flowMode = ALL_VESSEL
  transfer = PUMP
  color = 0.4 0.2 0.8
}

Yep, confirmed
It's just a generic testing resource, hence its name. No need to hype about it.
It was a test to see how the resource system behaved during development, IIRC. Since resources are known to be coming down the pipeline I'm not surprised they left it in there.

What's more important. Why does it have a color?

Ninja'd: still ominous

Edited December 13, 2013 by Tidus Klein

What's more important. Why does it have a color?

So it can be seen, since once in space black on black is nearly impossible to see.
thats why it has colour

thats why it has colour

um... what mod is that?

um... what mod is that?

That isn't a mod, that was Squad's dev work toward resources approx 0.19.

This picture was shown by devs when talk about resources started. We got some other tidbits of info that really got hype train chugging. Unfortunately SQUAD decided to develop other parts of career mode first. Since that day before announcement what will be in next update community is asking: "Resources?" So far answer was always: "Nah. Not this time."

It's just a generic testing resource, hence its name. No need to hype about it.

Testium isn't named after the fact it's a Test resource, no sir. It's named after Squad's love of the long form of cricket.

never mind I googled the name and found another thread just like this one, explaining everything. -.-

LINK

its nothing
